item.title: Sunny and Mainly Dry
item.description: Rain chances are also low with drier air in the upper atmosphere

item.title: Limited rain chances this week as dry air lingers
item.description: By the midweek, moisture returns… our summer-like rain chances come back by Thursday with a 50% chance of afternoon showers.

item.title: Judge hands down historic 156-year sentence to repeat child sex offender
item.description: A repeat offender has been sentenced to one of Alaska’s longest prison terms for sexual assault.

item.title: Federal government sues Uber over alleged discrimination against people with disabilities
item.description: The lawsuit alleges that Uber drivers have charged illegal cleaning fees for service animal shedding and imposed cancellation fees after denying service.

item.title: Venezuela says US navy raided a tuna boat in the Caribbean as tensions rise
item.description: Personnel from a U.S. warship boarded a Venezuelan tuna boat with nine fishermen while it was sailing in Venezuelan waters.

item.title: Funeral arrangements announced for late conservative activist Charlie Kirk
item.description: Funeral arrangements have been announced for Charlie Kirk, the conservative activist who was assassinated.

item.title: High school football player suffers brain bleed during game, rushed to hospital, officials say
item.description: A West Morgan High School football player fell to the ground during Friday’s game and was rushed to the hospital.

item.title: Fred Gilmore, legendary Booker High School coach, passes away
item.description: Fred Gilmore, an iconic figure in the history of Booker High School (BHS), and the City of Sarasota, has passed away.

item.title: ‘We have to be louder, now more than ever’: Sarasota residents rally in remembrance of Charlie Kirk
item.description: Kirk was the subject of a political assassination on Wednesday September 10th while speaking at Utah Valley University.

item.title: Booker High School mourns loss of iconic coach
item.description: Gilmore graduated from BHS in 1984 and later returned to his alma mater where he was coach in football, baseball and weightlifting for 32 years.

item.title: Dry to start the week on the Suncoast.
item.description: Dry air to start the week
